results.description: Read the 12 takeaways from this weekend's Scottish Premiership action.
results.title: Scottish Premiership: What did we learn from the weekend's games?

results.description: Managerless Hibernian hammer St Johnstone with Christian Doidge netting a hat-trick. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: St Johnstone 1-4 Hibernian

results.description: Christian Doidge admits his confidence had "gone a little bit" before his hat-trick fired managerless Hibernian to a 4-1 rout of St Johnstone.
results.title: Hibernian: Christian Doidge confidence had 'gone a little' before hat-trick

thumbnail.altText: Hibernian players celebrate Christian Doidge's goal against St Johnstone

results.description: A Christian Doidge hat-trick inspires managerless Hibernian to just a second Scottish Premiership win of the season as they rout St Johnstone in Perth.
results.shortTitle: Doidge hat-trick powers Hibs to rout
results.title: St Johnstone 1-4 Hibernian: Christian Doidge hat-trick powers visitors to second league win

results.description: Former Liverpool forward Harry Kewell describes Hibernian as "another option" as he watches the managerless side take on St Johnstone.
results.title: Hibernian manager's job 'an option' - Harry Kewell

results.description: Hibernian chief executive Leann Dempster has hit back at criticism of the club's transfer activity in the summer, suggesting the club's squad is more than good enough.
results.shortTitle: "I don't think anything went wrong" - Dempster
results.title: 'I don't think anything went wrong at Hibs' - Leann Dempster

results.description: Catch up with all the team news and stats for the six games taking place before the international break, and choose your preferred XI.
results.title: Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: Hibernian chief executive Leeann Dempster defends the under-fire club's summer recruitment after sacking head coach Paul Heckingbottom.
results.title: Hibernian: Chief executive Leeann Dempster defends under-fire club's summer recruitment

thumbnail.altText: Scott Allan, Melker Hallberg and Josh Vela of Hibernian

results.description: Hibernian supporter director Tracey Smith resigns due to "relentless" abuse aimed at her and staff at the under-fire Scottish Premiership club.
results.title: Hibernian: Supporter director resigns due to fan abuse

results.description: Hibernian hope to appoint a new head coach by the end of November, with chief executive Leeann Dempster insisting "there's no outstanding front-runner".
results.title: Leeann Dempster: Hibs aim for November head coach appointment

results.description: Livingston midfielder Marvin Bartley says he "did not recognise" former club Hibernian in the first half of last week's 2-2 draw at Easter Road.
results.shortTitle: 'It wasn't a Hibs team I recognised'
results.title: 'It wasn't a Hibs team I recognised' - Marvin Bartley on plight of former club

thumbnail.altText: Livingston midfielder Marvin Bartley left Hibs in the summer

results.description: BBC Scotland's Brian McLauchlin charts the downfall of Paul Heckingbottom's brief reign as manager at Easter Road.
results.shortTitle: The downfall of Heckingbottom at Hibs
results.title: Hibernian: Paul Heckingbottom and what let him down at Easter Road

results.description: Fans in Edinburgh have their say over the vacant managerial posts at Hearts and Hibernian.
results.shortTitle: Who do the fans want in charge in Edinburgh?
results.title: Fans give their say for the managerial posts at Hearts & Hibernian

results.description: Former midfielder Paul Kane says Hibs were right to sack manager Paul Heckingbottom and would like to see John Hughes return.
results.title: Hibernian: Paul Heckingbottom reign was 'detrimental' - Paul Kane

thumbnail.altText: Hibs sacked manager Paul Heckingbottom on Monday

results.description: Paul Heckingbottom is sacked as Hibernian head coach with the Leith club languishing 10th in the Scottish Premiership.
results.title: Hibernian: Paul Heckingbottom sacked as head coach

results.description: Former Manchester United manager David Moyes says he is not interested in becoming either Hearts or Hibernian manager.
results.shortTitle: Moyes rules out move to Hearts or Hibs
results.title: David Moyes 'not interested' in Hearts or Hibernian manager jobs

results.description: Hibernian face their own cup final next week against St Johnstone, says head coach Paul Heckingbottom, after his side fail to reach the Scottish League Cup showpiece.
results.shortTitle: Hibs face own cup final - Heckingbottom
results.title: Paul Heckingbottom: Hibs coach says next league match 'a cup final'

results.description: Celtic win their 30th consecutive domestic cup tie, beating Hibernian in a frantic game at Hampden, to set up a Scottish League Cup final against Rangers or Hearts.
results.shortTitle: Celtic reach fourth League Cup final in row
results.title: Hibernian 2-5 Celtic: Neil Lennon's side ease into final

results.description: Which Celtic player did you vote man of the match in the Scottish League Cup semi-final between Hibernian and Celtic at Hampden?
results.shortTitle: Which Celtic player did you vote man of the match?
results.title: Hibernian 2-5 Celtic: Which Celtic player did you vote man of the match?

results.description: Can you remember these players who have turned out for both Hibernian and Celtic? Try the BBC Scotland quiz.
results.shortTitle: Quiz: Who has played for both Hibs and Celtic?
results.title: Quiz: Who has played for Hibernian and Celtic?
